item.title: Information theory and coding
item.description: 1. Introduction It is a discipline that applies the methods of ==probability theory==, ==stochastic processes== , ==mathematical statistics== , and ==modern algebra== to study general laws in information transmission, extraction, and processing. 1.1 It researches the basic problem of Information theory—Measurement of information Distortion-Free Source Coding Theorem-Shannon's First Theorem Channel coding theorem-Shannon's second theorem Source coding, channel coding 1.2 Some important concepts Sample space: The various states in which something can occur
